#### An exploration of Stoic writings using R!

```{r, results='hide', warning=FALSE, message=FALSE}
library(tidyverse)
library(gutenbergr)
```

Ok, so let's search the "gutenbergr" library for some of the famous stoic thinkers.

```{r import text, warning=FALSE}

works <- gutenberg_works(languages = "en")

stoicWorks <- works %>% 
  filter(str_detect(author, "Aurelius") | str_detect(author, "Epictetus") | str_detect(author, "Seneca")) %>% 
  select(gutenberg_id, title, author)

stoicWorks
```

Cool! Looks like we've got some writings from each philosopher. Let's pick one text per author to look at more closely.

```{r message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}
Aurellius <- gutenberg_download(gutenberg_id = 2680)
Epictetus <- gutenberg_download(gutenberg_id = 10661)
Seneca <- gutenberg_download(gutenberg_id = 3794)
```
